title: Basic Anchor Tag
ques: Create an anchor tag that links to 'https://www.example.com' with the text 'Visit Example'.
explanation: The `````` tag is used to create hyperlinks. The ```href``` attribute specifies the destination URL. The text between the `````` and `````` tags ('Visit Example') is the clickable link text.

title: Opening Links in a New Tab
ques: Modify the previous anchor tag to open the link in a new tab.
explanation: Adding the ```target="_blank"``` attribute makes the link open in a new tab. The ```href``` attribute still specifies the destination URL. The link text remains between `````` and ``````.

title: Navigation Menu with Unordered List
ques: Create a simple navigation menu with links to Home, About, and Contact using an unordered list.
explanation:
The ```<ul>``` tag creates an unordered list.
Each ```<li>``` element represents a list item.
Each list item contains an ```<a>``` tag linking to different pages.
The ```href``` attribute specifies the path to the respective page.

title: Styled Navigation Menu
ques: Style a navigation menu horizontally with CSS.

answer.content:
• Home
  • About
  • Contact

explanation:
The ```<nav>``` element represents the navigation section.
The ```<ul>``` contains list items ```<li>``` with links.
The ```display: flex;``` style makes the menu horizontal.
The ```list-style-type: none;``` removes bullet points.
The ```margin-right: 15px;``` adds spacing between items.
The ```text-decoration: none;``` removes underlines from links.
The ```color: blue;``` and ```font-weight: bold;``` enhance the appearance.

title: Anchor Link to a Section
ques: Create an anchor link that jumps to a section with the id 'about-section'.

answer.content:
Go to About Section

About Us

This is the About section of the page.

explanation:
The ```href="#about-section"``` makes the link jump to the element with id ```about-section```.
The ```<section>``` element with ```id="about-section"``` is the target.
Clicking the link smoothly scrolls to the 'About Us' section.

title: Email Link
ques: Create an anchor tag that allows users to send an email to 'support@example.com' when clicked.
explanation:
The ```mailto:``` scheme is used in the ```href``` attribute to open the user's default email client.
The ```support@example.com``` is the recipient's email address.
When the link is clicked, an email composition window opens.

title: Phone Call Link
ques: Create a link that allows users to call the phone number '+1234567890' when clicked.
explanation:
The ```tel:``` scheme is used in the ```href``` attribute to initiate a phone call.
The ```+1234567890``` is the phone number.
Clicking the link on a mobile device starts a call to the specified number.

title: Download Link
ques: Create a link that allows users to download a file named 'document.pdf'.
explanation:
The ```download``` attribute allows the user to download the linked file instead of opening it.
The ```href="document.pdf"``` specifies the file path.
Clicking the link prompts the user to save the file.

title: Image as a Link
ques: Create an anchor tag that wraps an image and links to 'https://www.example.com'.
explanation: The `````` tag wraps an `````` tag, making the image a clickable link. The ```href``` attribute specifies the destination URL. The ```src``` attribute of `````` defines the image path ('logo.png'). The ```alt``` attribute provides alternative text.

title: Back to Top Link
ques: Create a 'Back to Top' link that takes the user to the top of the page.

answer.content:
Back to Top

Welcome

Scroll down to see the link.

explanation:
The ```href="#top"``` makes the link jump to an element with ```id="top"```.
The ```<h1 id="top">``` is the target element.
Clicking the link scrolls the page to the top.

title: Breadcrumb Navigation
ques: Create a breadcrumb navigation menu showing 'Home > Products > Laptops'.
explanation:
The ```<nav>``` element defines the navigation section.
Each ```<a>``` tag links to a higher-level page.
The 'Laptops' section is inside ```<span>``` because it's the current page and shouldn't be a link.

title: Navigation Menu with Dropdown
ques: Create a navigation menu with a dropdown for 'Services' containing 'Web Design' and 'SEO'.

answer.content:
• Home
  • Services
    • Web Design
    • SEO
  • Contact

explanation:
The ```<nav>``` contains an unordered list ```<ul>``` for navigation items.
A ```<li>``` with class ```dropdown``` contains another nested ```<ul>```.
The ```display: none;``` hides the dropdown initially.
Using ```:hover``` makes the dropdown visible when the user hovers over 'Services'.

title: Relative vs. Absolute Links
ques: Demonstrate the difference between an absolute and a relative link.
explanation:
An ***absolute link*** includes the full URL (```https://www.example.com```).
A ***relative link*** points to a file in the same directory (```about.html```).
Absolute links navigate to external sites, while relative links navigate within the same website.

title: Button Styled as a Link
ques: Create a button that acts as a link to 'https://www.example.com'.
explanation:
The ```<button>``` element is used instead of ```<a>```.
The ```onclick``` event handler changes the window location to 'https://www.example.com'.
Clicking the button redirects the user to the given URL.

title: Navigation Menu with Icons
ques: Create a navigation menu with icons next to the links using Font Awesome.

answer.content:
• Home
  • Services
  • Contact

explanation:
The ***Font Awesome*** library is linked in the ```<head>``` section.
Each ```<a>``` tag contains an ```<i>``` tag with a Font Awesome icon class.
Icons appear before the link text, improving visual appeal.
